result.execSummary:
The defendant Breeana R Carda was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Fine is to be paid at the rate of $50 per month commencing 04-01-2017 and the 1st of each month thereafter until paid in full or serve 5 days jail as penalty for failure to pay.
Court waives DNA surcharge and sample.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations (not prior to 01-02-2018).

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Breeana R Carda

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Breeana R Carda in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to the charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the charge.

Court orders the following:
Fine:  $326
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  Court Waives.
To be paid at the rate of $50 per month, starting 04/01/17 and 1st of every month until paid in full.
Alternate:  5  Days in the Waukesha County Jail.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees, no new criminal law violations, not prior to 01/02/18 and by application.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 1, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
